commit_list.repo_description: Example programs for the various go-gl packages.

commit_list.message:
Use GL 3.2 to illustrate multiple glow package use.

Using GL 4.4 is misleading because the example asks for a version-3.3
context which may not contain future-version functions. In general this
is a tricky combination to get right in production code but this example
simply demonstrates it is possible to initialize two glow packages in
the same program.
commit_list.repo_description: Example programs for the various go-gl packages.

but include go-gl copyright headers and a new README.

commit_list.message:
Use GL 3.2 to illustrate multiple glow package use.

Using GL 4.4 is misleading because the example asks for a version-3.3
context which may not contain future-version functions. In general this
is a tricky combination to get right in production code but this example
simply demonstrates it is possible to initialize two glow packages in
the same program.

Fix API supported regex when XML includes pipe

For some GLES extensions the XML supported clause includes a pipe, e.g., `supported="gl|gles2"`. Without these parentheses the regular expression was incorrectly allowing `gles1` to match against that supported clause.
Add gles1 and gles2 to README

Fix GLsync definition

Even though GLsync is defined as an opaque struct pointer, some drivers
use non-pointer values for GLsync, which is incompatible with Go pointer
semantics. As a workaround we redefine GLsync to be a pointer-width
numeric value.
